data.scheme_name: Package Scheme of Incentives 2019 - Incentives - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provides total benefit as a % of total Fixed Capital Investment subjcet to Taluka / Area Classification between group A, B, C, D, D+ and others ranging between 0 to 100% of total investment.
data.eligibility: All existing manufacturing units which has been set up and is in production on or any time prior to the 1st April, 2019 and  has been granted an Eligibility Certificate(EC) are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. Total incentives admissible to the eligible unit will not exceed 100 % of eligible FCI. 
  2. The eligible unit claiming, benefits under Expansion / Diversification shall be required to maintain separate record of production for such expansion. 
  3. A Unit which has filed a valid application for grant of an EC. 
  4. In case of MSME Units, consent to Establish for the proposed expansion / diversification shall be submitted. 
  5. Additional Investment should exceed 25% of the Gross Fixed Capital Investment of the Provision financial year.
  6. Minimum additional fixed capital investment of 25% of gross block, subject to minimum Rs. 25 lakhs. 
  7. Minimum addition of 25% production capacity. 
  8. Minimum 10% increase in employment, of this 80% should be locally sourced.
data.beneficiaries: All existing manufacturing units which has been set up and is in production on or any time prior to the 1st April, 2019 and  has been granted an Eligibility Certificate(EC) are eligible under this scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. Total incentives admissible to the eligible unit will not exceed 100 % of eligible FCI. 
  2. The eligible unit claiming, benefits under Expansion / Diversification shall be required to maintain separate record of production for such expansion. 
  3. A Unit which has filed a valid application for grant of an EC. 
  4. In case of MSME Units, consent to Establish for the proposed expansion / diversification shall be submitted. 
  5. Additional Investment should exceed 25% of the Gross Fixed Capital Investment of the Provision financial year.
  6. Minimum additional fixed capital investment of 25% of gross block, subject to minimum Rs. 25 lakhs. 
  7. Minimum addition of 25% production capacity. 
  8. Minimum 10% increase in employment, of this 80% should be locally sourced.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Industries, Government of Maharashtra
data.context: In order to encourage the dispersal of industries to lesser developed areas of the State, the Government has been giving package of incentives to New Industrial Units / Expansion /Diversification Units set up in the developing regions of the State under Package Incentive Scheme - 2019.
data.objective: To help the units achieve higher, sustainable and inclusive economic growth with emphasis on balanced regional development and employment generation through greater Private and Public Investment in industrial sector.
data.description:
Scheme provides total benefit as a % of total Fixed Capital Investment subjcet to Taluka / Area Classification between group A, B, C, D, D+ and others ranging between 0 to 100% of total investment. 

  • 100% against SGST payment 
  • Up to 5% against bank interest payable 
  • Stamp duty waiver 
  • Subsidy of Rs. 1 per unit of power tariff
data.how_to_apply: An application for eligibility under the PSI - 2019 Scheme shall be submitted to the Implementing Agency by an Eligible Unit.
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Industries, Government of Maharashtra
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefits after the approval of application from the concerned authority.
data.faq: Investor's Guide Directorate of Industries, Government of Maharashtra
data.additional_info:
1. Units that are not eligible under this scheme : Beer, liquor manufacturing industries Cigarette, bidi or any other tobacco containing products, manufacturing industries Gutka and pan masala manufacturing industries
  2. . Any other product(s) banned by Central / State Government Classification of Areas for PSI-2019 : 
    • Group A : Denotes industrially developed areas 
    • Group B: Denotes areas where some industrial development has taken place, but are less developed than the areas under Group A. 
    • Group C: Denotes areas, which are less developed than those covered under Group B. 
    • Group D: Denotes the lesser-developed areas of the State, not covered under Group A/ Group B/ Group C Group D+: Denotes the least developed areas, not covered under Group A/ Group B/ Group C/ Group D. 
  3. No Industry District: Denotes District having no industries viz Hingoli and Gadchiroli. 
  4. Naxalism Affected Area: Denotes area affected by naxalism, as described in GR No NAVIKA-2008/C.R. 209/Ka. 1416 Dated 31.5.2009 (Annexure II) or as may be amended by the Government. 
  5. Aspirational Districts: defined by Government of India viz. Washim, Gadchiroli, Osmanabad and Nandurbar.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Udyam Registration Certificate 
2. Proof of Business address 
3. Annexure-A* 
4. Annexure-B* 
5. Certified Copies of SGST Returns and tax paid challans 
6. Statutory SGST Audit Report 
7. Annexure-C* 
8. Annexure-D* 
9. Audited financial statements 
10. Annual Follow-up Report 
11. Board Resolution empowering signatory for signing application 
12. Other basic KYC documents
